pageContext.claim: “The USMCA will create nearly 100,000 new high-paying American auto jobs.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a dubious figure; we often warn readers to be wary of job-creation claims. The U.S. International Trade Commission, which is tasked with evaluating the impact of trade agreements, said the agreement would create about 28,000 jobs in the auto sector. The office of the U.S. Trade Representative estimated that the deal would support 76,000 jobs in the auto sector -- 22,800 assembly jobs and then additional auto supply jobs.
